content.description: Climb the flake. This is a nice warm-up.
content.location: Obvious right-facing flake/corner on the right side of Darkness Wall, left of the Magic Arête.

content.description: Compress and slap your way up
content.location: The large block on Lowball Wall, left of Spearhead

content.description:
Slab! Find the right feet and trust them. Topout involves some confidence in smearing. May be much more difficult for shorter folks.

 Descent path goes left and curves down a slab. Be careful not to slip on leaves.
content.protection: One pad okay, two pads better to cover the protruding rocks at the base.
content.location: Rightmost route on Lowball Wall, just around the left corner from the Main Wall

content.description: Start on the good shelf and climb straight up using some fancy footwork.
content.location: Right-most route on Darkness Wall (first route left of "Refridgenator" on the Magic Arête.)

content.description: Fun compression problem that requires a tensiony SDS. Landing zone is sketch so have a spotter or don't drop it.
content.location: On obvious opposing aretes, start low using the feet below the right arete.

content.description: Stem and smear up the often-wet corner
content.location: Corner right of the Main Wall

content.description: Start with match on low crimp, deadpoint to next crimp ledge. Massive juggy flake to the right is off as well as pretty much any hold that isn't a crimp. Find small crimp and match, then shoot to the top; requires some people to dyno.
content.location: Located in the middle of the area on the almost blank white section of wall.

content.description:
Hand crack with a few holds inside.

 Descent path goes left and curves down a slab. Be careful not to slip on leaves. Warning: There is a wide crack across the descent trail above the Main Wall. Watch your step!
content.location: Wider crack on right side of the Main wall.

content.description: Easy start holds then straight into high feet , smallish crimps, and a thumb press.
content.protection: 1 pad, but if you go out to the arete, use 2

content.description:
Start on the rightward flake and the seemingly detached, but solid, block. Work your way up, make a huge cross over to the right, then heave yourself to the top.

 Descent path goes left and curves down a slab. Be careful not to slip on leaves. Warning: There is a wide crack across the descent trail above the Main Wall. Watch your step!

 Trivia: The style of lettering and obsolete spelling of "enforced" dates this sign to the 1950's, as best as I can figure.
content.location: The face of the Main Wall with the faded No Parking sign, between the two cracks.

content.description:
Off-fingers crack that leans to the right, with a few face holds/feet.

 Descent path goes left and curves down a slab. Be careful not to slip on leaves. Warning: There is a wide crack across the descent trail above the Main Wall. Watch your step!
content.location: Left crack on the Main Wall

content.description: Left up the arete, Right in the crack, all the way up. Left crossover to the nice ledge then topout.

Squeeze the edge of the crack and the arête on the right, and slap your way to the top.

 Descent path goes left and curves down a slab. Be careful not to slip on leaves. Warning: There is a wide crack across the descent trail above the Main Wall. Watch your step!
content.location: Rightmost line on the Main Wall

content.description: Easy climbing up the tallest part of Darkness Wall
content.protection: pads, but really: falling should not be considered an option
content.location: Step down into the ditch below Darkness Wall. Climb the corner, mostly using the right face.

content.description: North-facing, quarried granite boulders with some good problems including "Fade Away," a Richmond classic. The Main Wall is clean, and probably what you came for, but there are decent established lines on the other walls that need to be cleaned up a little more, and also require more pads for safe landings.
